RE: License#: CB280201014
CATHOLIC HUMAN SERVICES INC - TR
1000 HASTINGS ST,
TRAVERSE CITY, MI, 49686-3445
Dear Mr. Cieslinski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
January 24, 2023. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules. As indicated above substantial compliance has been
established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Kari Muntean, Area Manager, at 734-395-0920.
Sincerely,
Douglas W Turrill, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. The agency is
non-contracted.
3.) MDHHS Contract. The agency is non-contracted.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not required at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency was in compliance with all licensing rules during the licensing period.
The agency was not required to submit a CAP from the previous interim inspection
completed on January 21, 2022. There were no complaints filed against the agency
during the licensing period.
Chief Administrators Assessment: The Chief Administrators Assessment was
reviewed. The assessment noted that the facility is in compliance with all rules. The
assessment noted that “it is difficult finding birth family members and this has
caused a reduction in the number adoptive families in the prospective pool”.
Interviews: Discussion with the adoption worker occurred at the entrance
conference and at a subsequent telephone call. The adoption worker works part time
and completes home studies as needed. He reported the agency program continues
to be small. The adoption worker stated that he really enjoys working at the agency
and that he has a supportive and enjoyable working relationship with his supervisor,
the chief administrator of the agency.
CPA ANALYST FINDINGS: The agency is a non-contracted adoption agency
therefore the CPA Analyst was not involved in the renewal audit.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
January 25, 2023
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
February 2, 2023
Kari Muntean Date
Area Manager
